subject: Re: [junit] Adding Test details to the JUnit Report
msgSnippet: Hi Shay, I m sure it is not exactly what you want, but I made a tool for creating nice documents from a JUnit4.4 test suite. You can add text and other stuff
messageBody:
Hi Shay,

I'm sure it is not exactly what you want, but I made a tool for creating
nice documents from a JUnit4.4 test suite.

You can add text and other stuff in comments in the tests, and those
things show up in the resulting document.

If this sounds interesting, please have a look at
http://agical.com/bumblebee/bumblebee_doc.html
for more details.
There is also a Google grop I recently started where I hope to keep
discussions around the tool
http://groups.google.com/group/bumblebee-tool

Cheers
Daniel

On Tue, 2008-06-24 at 15:19 -0500, Shay Thompson wrote:
> I need to add some details to the JUnit Report for some processing
> done
> afterwords. Things like the owner of the test. Is there any way this
> can be specified somewhere in the JUnit Test so that it ends up in
> the
> Report? I was thinking annotations or javadoc tags but I don't see a
> way to get those in the Report.
>
> Thanks,
> Shay
